description:
If a  nova-compute service is down (power failure) the instances shown in nova list are still  in active state while nova service-list reports "down" for the corresponding hypervisor.

nova list should check the hypervisor state and report "unknown / undefined" for an instances running on a hypervisor where the nova-compute is "down".
title: vm status incorrect if hypervisor is broken

comments.content:
If a  nova-compute service is down (power failure) the instances shown in nova list are still  in active state while nova service-list reports "down" for the corresponding hypervisor.

nova list should check the hypervisor state and report "unknown / undefined" for an instances running on a hypervisor where the nova-compute is "down".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~naehring

comments.content:
The described behavior is reproducible with devstack:
    Devstack commit: 84acb7a3a9af63e35ecc043d1426f568904ac22c
    Nova commit: 7ddf7aab4edb09fab6e5b8f49461f7dbaa4da4a2
    local.conf: http://paste.openstack.org/show/281460/
    showterm session: http://showterm.io/81a3a0806e0d2911c71f6
    (I interrupted the service "n-cpu" in the "rejoin-stack.sh" script and waited for ca. 2 minutes)

What is the benefit of listing the state of an instance to "unknown / undefined"? The last known state is "active" and it should still be possible to access the instance via network. Right know there is no "unknown / undefined" state in nova [1]. Is this bug maybe a change request?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/vm_states.py
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
Imagine, a hypervisor running 20 instances crashes with a power failure.
- nova service-list reports "down" for the nova-compute running the hypervisor
- nova list show 20 instances running

These instances are not available, they are not up and not reachable with the network. So it would be better to set the instance state to  e.g. "unknown" because the nova api is not able to give the correct result with the data it have. If a nova-compute service is down and instances are active prior registering the service is down, the instance state for this instances should not report "active".

Hope that clarifies my problem.

It wasn't fully clarified if this is really a bug or a an enhancement. I tend to the latter but I'm not 100% sure. Introducing a new state isn't a trivial thing, I guess, and I assume that some folks like to discuss this in a blueprint-spec, especially because this seems to change the API.
